body:
Recently we had a bit of a debate about whether we would implement private chats, so I decided to ask you guys whether you would like them! *Note* If we do have private chats would you rather have chats that can be made by anyone, but disappear when you leave, or we could have X amount of private chats, but too get in you have too ask a mod for the password.

Anyways, Discuss!
body_tagged:
Recently we had a bit of a debate about whether we would implement private chats, so I decided to ask you guys whether you would like them! *Note* If we do have private chats would you rather have chats that can be made by anyone, but disappear when you leave, or we could have X amount of private chats, but too get in you have too ask a mod for the password.

Anyways, Discuss!
title: Private Chats on Teamspeak!

replies.body: Love this idea! I think it would be very good.
replies.body_tagged: Love this idea! I think it would be very good.

replies.body:
I'm just going to Copy & Paste what I said in the Staff Discussion.

How about a custom made channel? You create the channel under the 'Custom Channels' section then add a password, poke whoever you want to join it the password. Custom channel right there.
And when the creator logs out, it deletes itself

replies.body: I honestly think this is a bad idea. People like privacy, and I understand this, but I really like being able to go on Teamspeak and meet new people. This is just a personal preference, but it doesnt really effect me that much considering I find private chats unnecessary anyways.Whether this does get implemented or not, I just hope that group activity on teamspeak doesn't change.

This is just a personal preference, but it doesnt really effect me that much considering I find private chats unnecessary anyways.Whether this does get implemented or not, I just hope that group activity on teamspeak doesn't change.

replies.body: Yes!Yes! Very much Yes! They are so useful, if you want to just hang out with friends without randies butting in, or for tournaments. Private rooms for tourney teams might be the only reasonable way for team members to communicate during tournament matches privately.
